string.value: #b#p1202007##k, a penguin from #b#m140000000##k, wants to talk to you about something.

According to the data #p1202007# has studied, wolves go through a kind of puberty during their adolescent years. They say that if you don't take special care of wolves during this time, they might not grow properly! #p1202007# then mentions that in order to raise #t1902015# well, you should ask advice from some veterans of wolf-raising.

#y21608# #b(#u21608#)#k
#y21610# #b(#u21610#)#k
After listening to everyone's advice on how to raise a wolf, you noticed that your #t1902016# had grown a bit. You need to take good care of your wolf now that it is going through puberty.

Hi there. How's #t1902015# doing? Has is been acting rebellious, by any chance? I've been studying wolves and I've learned… Well, I've learned that wolves actually go through a kind of puberty during their adolescent years.

Apparently, wolf pups that don't go through puberty fail to grow properly, which means you'll have to really take care of #t1902015# in order for it to reach its maximum potential. Maybe #basking for advice from others#k might help you.
I want you to seek advice from people who know about wolves, like #b#p2060000##k and #b#p2020007##k. I really want you to handle #t1902015#'s adolescent period with extra care.
Hmmm… So, do you actually believe in raising your wolf all by yourself and think that asking for help is bad? I say, hearing advice from others can never hurt.

Did you receive a lot of good advice from others before you came here? So what do you think? Do you think it helped #t1902015#? Let's see how much #t1902015# has grown since the last time we talked. Please hand me #t1902015#.
Oh, I can see that #t1902016# has grown considerably! You can't even call it a pup anymore! It's gone through adolescence, so… maybe a teen wolf?
It's all because you were able to take such good care of my #t1902016# during its adolescent years. Please take care of my #t1902016# for me.

Did you receive all the advice you need on how to raise a wolf pup? Please go talk to #b#p2060000##k and #b#p2020007##k, and follow their advice. That should be enough for #t1902015# to weather the storm of adolescence.
